content.description: Let random variable <math alttext="U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the field goal percentage (percentage of shots made) for players in a basketball league. The following table shows the probability distribution of the random variable <math alttext="U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: Field Goal Percentage Probability 0.3 0.10 0.4 0.45 0.5 0.30 0.6 0.10 0.7 0.05 Fatima claims that the distribution of <math alttext="U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is uniform with a median of 0.4 field goal percentage. Is Fatimaâ€™s claim supported by the table?

choices.label: Yes, the distribution is uniform with a median of 0.4 field goal percentage.
No, the distribution is uniform with a median of 0.5 field goal percentage.
No, the distribution is skewed to the right with a median of 0.4 field goal percentage.
No, the distribution is skewed to the right with a median of 0.5 field goal percentage.
No, the distribution is skewed to the left with a median of 0.4 field goal percentage.

content.answer: No, the distribution is skewed to the right with a median of 0.4 field goal percentage.

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

topic.text: 4.7: Introduction to Random Variables and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
